page.title: 13Landscape - Colton
page.content: Colton is a small linear village, which lies on the south side of the A64 road.It is some 60 feet above sea level.It has rich fertile soil, ideal for producing cash crops. There are about 50 houses in the village and surrounding area including the farms.There is a church, a public house and a village shop cum post office.Mobile shops visit the area.One of the farmers runs a dairy, and supplies milk. In 1983 the parish population of Colton was 150.There are 8 council houses.At the western end of the village is a farm, which has a small riding school and stables.Nearby is a large modern house.The owner is a farmer,who deals extensively in grain and potatoes.The general picture is arable farmland interspersed with grazing and deciduous copses.
